meanings.definition: A person who is defeated or unsuccessful in a competition or struggle.
meanings.sent1: The loser of the race felt sad.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like a loser when playing board games.
meanings.sent3: The loser of the dance-off tried to laugh it off.
meanings.sent4: Being a loser in the game of life can be tough.
meanings.sent5: The image of the loser crossing the finish line last stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: A person who is disadvantaged or unsuccessful in life.
meanings.sent1: The little girl felt like a loser because she couldn't afford new toys.
meanings.sent2: He was considered a loser by his classmates because he struggled in school.
meanings.sent3: The loser of the bet had to wear a silly hat all day.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a loser in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The loser of the talent show felt like the world was against them.
